CE 3372 Water Systems Design

Catalog Description

3372. Water Systems Design (3:3:0). Prerequisite: CE 3305, 3354. Hydraulic analysis and design of municipal water distribution, stormwater collection, and wastewater collection systems. Oral and written presentations. (Communication Intensive)

EXERCISES AND PROJECTS

CE 3372 Exercises (1-8)

ES-1 Los Angeles Aquaduct (Article Summary)

ES-2 Elevation Maps for Somewhere USA Subdivision

ES-3 Demand Estimation for Somewhere USA Subdivision

ES-4 Application of Head Loss Models

ES-5 Pump Selection

ES-6 Equalization Tank Sizing

ES-7 Introduction to EPANET Application

ES-8 EPANET Network Analysis

CE 3372 Project 1

Report 1 Water distribution system design and demonstration of anticipated performance under varying conditions.

EU-Problem Water distribution system design and demonstration of anticipated performance under varying conditions (WDSA 2022 Battle of the Networks Challenge).

CE 3372 Exercises (9 - 16)

ES-9 Design Storm and Runoff Hydrograph

ES-10 Open Channel Hydraulics

ES-11 Open Channel Hydraulics in SWMM

ES-12 Rational Method Conduit Sizing

ES-13 SWMM Model Tanglewilde

ES-14 Detention Pond in SWMM

ES-15 Estimate Outfall Erosion Potential (in-progress)

ES-16 Sanitary Sewer Inflow and Infiltration (in-progress)

CE 3372 Project 2

Report 2 Stormwater collection system design and demonstration of anticipated performance under varying conditions.
